final_answer.precision_note: Result reported to 3 significant figures, consistent with the precision of current (1.50 A), time (30.0 min), and atomic mass of Cu (63.55).

method: First, convert time to seconds: t = 30.0 min × 60 = 1800 s. Calculate charge using Q = I × t: Q = 1.50 A × 1800 s = 2700 C. Calculate moles of electrons using n(e-) = Q/F: n(e-) = 2700 C / 96500 C mol-1 = 0.02798 mol. From the half-equation Cu2+ + 2e- → Cu, 2 moles of electrons deposit 1 mole of Cu. Therefore, n(Cu) = 0.02798 / 2 = 0.01399 mol. Finally, mass of Cu = n × Ar = 0.01399 mol × 63.55 g mol-1 = 0.889 g.
